newsitem.title: USA: Compaq cuts prices on U.S. desktop computers.
newsitem.headline: Compaq cuts prices on U.S. desktop computers.

text.p: Compaq Computer Corp said it has cut prices across-the-board on all U.S. commercial desktop computers and select Netelligent Fast Ethernet 100Base-T Repeaters.
Compaq said it lowered prices on its Deskpro 2000, 4000 and 6000 models from 12 to 20 percent. Prices on traditional Pentium Pro Deskpro XLs and ProLinea E models were reduced by up to 39 percent.

In a related move, Compaq reduced prices on its Netelligent Fast Ethernet 100Base-T repeaters by up to 28 percent. The reductions are a reflection of Compaq's ability to lower the cost of ownership across both desktop computing and internetworking products and enhance valuable cost-effective manageability solutions, it said.

"Compaq continues its relentless focus on price/performance leadership while increasing overall value for our customers," said Ross Cooley, Senior Vice President and General Manager, Compaq North America. "With these price reductions in the U.S., we are again well-positioned to take advantage of the sales opportunities in the busiest sales season of the year."
